author: Thoughty2
description: A single black hole can outshine thousands of galaxies, yes, really. That glowing ring? Its accretion disk, slinging matter at nearly half the speed of light. Imagine a planet orbiting just beyond the event horizon — time there crawls tens of thousands of times slower than on Earth. In Interstellar, an hour on Miller’s World was seven years back home. Considering life on Earth took 500 million years to appear, this unlucky exoplanet probably hasn’t had a chance to evolve anything… yet. Black holes, time dilation, and cosmic oddities — mind-bending stuff, isn’t it?
title: Could Orbiting a Black Hole Make Time Stand Still? Almost!
